title: Relates to late applications for certain tax exemptions
summary: Entitles eligible senior citizens to a credit to be applied to taxes for the following fiscal year where such senior citizen files a late application for a real property tax exemption; removes the requirement that a death or illness constitute the only reason an application may be accepted after the deadline.

       Introduced  by M. of A. CALHOUN -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Real Property Taxation

       AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to late  applica-
         tions for certain exemptions

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 5-a of section 467 of  the  real  property  tax
    2  law,  as added by chapter 769 of the laws of 1992, is amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    5-a. Any local law or ordinance adopted pursuant to paragraph  (a)  of
    5  subdivision  one of this section may be amended, or a local law or ordi-
    6  nance may be adopted to provide,  notwithstanding  subdivision  five  of
    7  this  section,  that an application for such exemption may be filed with
    8  the assessor after the appropriate taxable status  date  [but].  IF  THE
    9  APPLICATION  IS  FILED  not later than the last date on which a petition
   10  with respect to complaints of assessment may be filed, [where failure to
   11  file a timely application resulted from: (a) a death of the  applicant's
   12  spouse,  child,  parent,  brother  or  sister;  or (b) an illness of the
   13  applicant or of  the  applicant's  spouse,  child,  parent,  brother  or
   14  sister,  which  actually  prevents the applicant from filing on a timely
   15  basis, as certified by a licensed physician.  The]  THE  assessor  shall
   16  approve  or  deny  such application as if it had been filed on or before
   17  the taxable status date.  IF THE APPLICATION IS FILED  AFTER  SUCH  DATE
   18  AND  THE  ASSESSOR  DETERMINES  THAT THE APPLICANT MEETS ALL ELIGIBILITY
   19  STANDARDS OTHERWISE PRESCRIBED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION,  THE  APPLICANT
   20  SHALL  BE ENTITLED TO A CREDIT TO BE APPLIED AGAINST THE TAXES LEVIED BY
   21  EACH MUNICIPAL CORPORATION WHICH LEVIES TAXES ON THE PROPERTY  EQUAL  TO
   22  THE  AMOUNT WHICH WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE BEEN RECEIVED BY THE APPLICANT IF
   23  THE APPLICATION WERE FILED IN A TIMELY  MANNER.  SUCH  CREDIT  SHALL  BE
   24  APPLIED IN THE NEXT FISCAL YEAR.
   25    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately and shall be applicable to
   26  assessment  rolls prepared on the basis of a taxable status date follow-
   27  ing the effective date of this act.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
